title: 2022: MAD research group has been awarded a $15,000 grant by the Multi Agency Research Network (MARN).
2021: Massey University Research Fund awarded to examine ways for mitigating COVID-19 infodemic (misinformation) – Dr Hamed Jafarzadeh
2021 Massey University Research Fund awarded to investigate "Work-life conflict of social media managers." By Kasuni Weerasinghe, David Pauleen, Jane Parker and Hamed Jafarzadeh ($5,200)
2020: Massey University Research Fund awarded to investigate the role of IT mindfulness in effective agile software development – Dr Hamed Jafarzadeh, Dr Nazim Taskin

2016 PVC Big Issues in Business Impactful Research Fund on “Ubiquitous Data, Powerful Analytics and Embedded Information Systems: Preparing for Tectonic Shifts in Business, Government and Society” by David Pauleen, Nazim Taskin, and Shane Scahill ($25,000)
2016 School of Management Fund on “Advanced Analytics and Decision Making” by David Pauleen, Nazim Taskin, and Shane Scahill ($9,000)
2014 Massey University Research Fund awarded to investigate "Integral Decision and Policy making in Business and Government" with Ali Intezari, David Pauleen, and Nazim Taskin ($4,500)

Children's rights to privacy in the era of Big Data. By Associate Professor Janet Sayers, Professor David Pauleen, and the MAD team within the School of Management are advisors to the project which is funded by InternetNZ.
